Package ohos.agp.database

Class Publisher<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.database.Publisher<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Indicates the publisher type.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataSetPublisher, PageSliderIndicator.IndicatorSelectionHandler

    public abstract class Publisher<T>
extends Object
    An abstract class used to register and deregister a subscriber.

    This class provides a list of subscribers as well as three abstract interfaces for registering a subscriber, deregister a subscriber, and deregister all subscribers. You can call the child interfaces of the three abstract interfaces to manage subscriber registrations.

    Since:
    3

    • Field Detail

      • mSubscribers

        protected final List<T> mSubscribers
        Indicates the subscriber list variable.

        This variable is used to store registered subscribers for unified management. Its type is List, and its size is determined by Java implementation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Publisher

        public Publisher​()

    • Method Detail

      • registerSubscriber

        public void registerSubscriber​(T subscriber)
        Registers subscribers with the subscriber list.

        This method is used to register multiple subscribers of the same type so that the subscribers' interfaces can be called in an uniform manner to handle changes on observed objects.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - Indicates the subscriber variable.

      • unregisterSubscriber

        public void unregisterSubscriber​(T subscriber)
        Removes an subscriber from the subscriber list.

        This method is used to deregister an subscriber by removing it from the subscriber list. A deregistered subscriber cannot perceive changes made for its observed objects.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - Indicates the subscriber variable.

      • unregisterSubscriber

        public void unregisterSubscriber​(long subscriber)
        Removes a subscriber from the subscriber list.

        This method is used to deregister a subscriber by removing it from the subscriber list. A deregistered subscriber cannot perceive changes made for its observed objects.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - Indicates the subscriber native pointer.
        Since:
        3
